intro: Sida oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu sida, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy surface, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Sida oahuensis is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the shores of Oahu.
